is clear that laying on of hands was visibly
done, outwardly apparent, Simon saw it, surely
then praier was vocal and apparent, they both
did pray; and not as some would have it, one
did pray vocallie, and the other mentallie.
But some may quaerie further, did they lay on
hands both at a time, viz. Peter and John?
truly the text is not clear in that particular,
onlie the text saith thus much, they laid on their
hands on the Samaritans, they, in the plurall
number. I shall say no more as to these circumstances,
I hope those which are judicious
will not stand upon such niceties as these are,
but rather will mind substantials; and so I shall
desire the Reader to make his progresse unto
the next particular, and leave this unto
consideration.
CHAP. IIII,
Is concerning the ends wherefore laying on
of ands it is to be administered upon baptized
believers.
I Am not ignorant that the whole weight of
the controversie lies in the clearing up of
this point, and why? because there hath been
a great deal of difference amongst the people
of
[37]
of God, and that as to the ends wherefore
hands are to be laid upon baptized believers;
and also the ends wherefore they were laid upon
baptized believers in former times; the contention
about this point hath been so much the
stronger, because of some contrarie ends which
have been proposed by some in opposition unto
those right ends which I shall here lay
down. And because we may observe a right
order and method for the profit of all, I shall
therefore first lay down those ends which I
judge to be of most strength and life for the
maintenance of what is formerly laid down;
And then I shall come in the next place to overthrow
those supposed ends which are
brought in by others.
In the first place I shall affirm, that one end
wherefore persons are to have hands laid on
them, is, that so they may be put into a further
capacitie of going on to perfection. I
would not here be mistaken, I do not say others
who have not subjected unto this principle
are no waies in a capacitie of going on to
perfection; But this is that I do affirm, namely,
that those baptized believers who have
subjected unto this truth, are put into a further
way of capacitie of going on to perfection, and
therefore this is one end wherefore it is to be
